brief_summary.textblock:
The aims of this four-year study are to

        1. Explore exercise behavior, exercise barriers, and identify the significant factors for
           exercise behavior in colorectal cancer survivors.

        2. Explore the relationships among fatigue, muscle strength, and metabolomics and further
           examine the possible biomarkers from muscle strength and metabolomics for fatigue.

        3. Develop a clinical guidelines of home-based fatigue management and exercise program and
           test its effect on decreasing fatigue for patients with colorectal cancer after surgery
           in Taiwan.

clinical_study.brief_title: Developing Objective Fatigue Indicators in Colorectal Cancer Survivors.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Colorectal cancer survivors completed treatment at least 3 months in clinics.

          -  Aged above 20.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  KPS < 60

          -  Stage 4

          -  Bone meta

clinical_study.official_title: Developing Objective Fatigue Indicators: Exploring the Relationships Among Fatigue, Muscle Power and Metabolomics Through Fatigue Management and Individualized Exercise Education Program in Colorectal Cancer Survivors.

primary_outcome.description: Develope the clinical exercise education program guideline for patients with early stage colorectal cancer survivor.
primary_outcome.measure: Developing Objective Fatigue Indicators: Exploring the Relationships Among Fatigue, Muscle Power and Metabolomics Through Fatigue Management and Individualized Exercise Education Program in Colorectal Cancer Survivors

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
